Generation V.Black: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.
Generation V.White: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
Generation V.Black 2: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
Generation V.White 2: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

Generation VI.X: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
Generation VI.Y: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

Generation VIII.Sword: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.
Generation VIII.Shield: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won't slow until their target goes down.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
Generation IX.Violet: It's said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.

Generation VIII.Sword: Bridge Field , Dusty Bowl , Giant's Mirror , Stony Wilderness , West Lake Axewell ( Max Raid Battle )
